examples: Taste gives knowledge of the savors of material things. Touch gives knowledge of form, smoothness, roughness, hardness, softness, pressure, temperature. Hearing gives knowledge of sound and distinguishes noises, musical tones, [...]

verbs.description: savor (third-person singular simple present savors, present participle savoring, simple past and past participle savored)

examples: An explanation of life phenomena that savors of the laboratory and chemism repels me, and an explanation that savors of the theological point of view is  equally distasteful to me. I crave and seek a natural explanation of all phenomenaÂ ...
